newsitem.title: USA: US Plains cattle trade thin at $64, up $1-feedlots.
newsitem.headline: US Plains cattle trade thin at $64, up $1-feedlots.

text.p: U.S. Plains feedlot cattle traded in light volume at $64.00 per cwt in the central and southern Plains, up $1.00 from last week, cattle feeders said.
About 2,500 head sold in the Texas Panhandle and western Oklahoma area and about 2,000 in Kansas, they said.
But sales were limited as some bids at $64.00 were passed by owners pricing cattle at $65.00, with a few at $66.00, sources said.
Cattle prices were supported by sharply higher beef prices this week and higher cattle prices in Nebraska, where $65.00 was reported in active trading, several cattle feeders said.
